text: On which amateur frequencies in the 10-meter band may stations with a General class control operator transmit CW emissions?
What is the maximum height above ground for an antenna structure not near a public use airport without requiring notification to the FAA and registration with the FCC?
What is the maximum power limit on the 60-meter band?
choices: ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to a dipole
ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to an isotropic antenna

text: What action is required to obtain a new General class license after a previously held license has expired and the two-year grace period has passed?
choices: They must have a letter from the FCC showing they once held an amateur or commercial license
There are no requirements other than being able to show a copy of the expired license
Contact the FCC to have the license reinstated
The applicant must show proof of the appropriate expired license grant and pass the current Element 2 exam

text: In what part of the 2.4 GHz band may an amateur station communicate with non-licensed Wi-Fi stations?
Which mode is most commonly used for SSB voice communications in the VHF and UHF bands?
When selecting a CW transmitting frequency, what minimum separation from other stations should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?
What should you do if a CW station sends ΓÇ£QRS?ΓÇ¥
Which of the following describes an azimuthal projection map?
choices: A map that shows accurate land masses
A map that shows true bearings and distances from a specific location
A map that shows the angle at which an amateur satellite crosses the equator
A map that shows the number of degrees longitude that an amateur satellite appears to move westward at the equator with each orbit

text: What symptoms may result from other signals interfering with a PACTOR or VARA transmission?
choices: Failure to establish a connection between stations

text: Approximately how long does it take the increased ultraviolet and X-ray radiation from a solar flare to affect radio propagation on Earth?
Which frequency will have the least attenuation for long-distance skip propagation?
Which ionospheric region is closest to the surface of Earth?
What happens as a receiverΓÇÖs noise reduction control level is increased?
choices: CW signals may become severely attenuated
Received frequency may shift several kHz

text: What is an advantage of a digital multimeter as compared to an analog multimeter?
Why should soldered joints not be used in lightning protection ground connections?
choices: A soldered joint will likely be destroyed by the heat of a lightning strike
Solder flux will prevent a low conductivity connection
Solder has too high a dielectric constant to provide adequate lightning protection

text: How does a signal that reads 20 dB over S9 compare to one that reads S9 on a receiver, assuming a properly calibrated S meter?
What is one disadvantage of using a shortened mobile antenna as opposed to a full-size antenna?
choices: Short antennas are more likely to cause distortion of transmitted signals
Q of the antenna will be very low
Operating bandwidth may be very limited

text: What unit is used to measure reactance?
What is the ratio of PEP to average power for an unmodulated carrier?
What is the approximate total resistance of a 100- and a 200-ohm resistor in parallel?
What is the minimum allowable discharge voltage for maximum life of a standard 12-volt lead-acid battery?
What kind of device is an integrated circuit operational amplifier?
Which of the following is characteristic of a switchmode power supply as compared to a linear power supply?
choices: Faster switching time makes higher output voltage possible
High-frequency operation allows the use of smaller components

text: What determines the frequency of an LC oscillator?
choices: The number of stages in the counter
The number of stages in the divider
The inductance and capacitance in the tank circuit
The time delay of the lag circuit

text: What output is produced by a balanced modulator?
choices: Audio extracted from the modulation signal

text: What type of modulation is used by FT8?
What is another term for the mixing of two RF signals?
Which of the following provide digital voice modes?
choices: Winlink, PACTOR II, and PACTOR III

text: What causes reflected power at an antennaΓÇÖs feed point?
choices: Operating an antenna at its resonant frequency
Using more transmitter power than the antenna can handle
A difference between feed line impedance and antenna feed point impedance
Feeding the antenna with unbalanced feed line

text: Which of the following is a common way to adjust the feed point impedance of an elevated quarter-wave ground-plane vertical antenna to be approximately 50 ohms?
choices: Lengthen the radials beyond one wavelength

text: What is meant by the ΓÇ£main lobeΓÇ¥ of a directive antenna?
choices: The magnitude of the maximum vertical angle of radiation
The point of maximum current in a radiating antenna element
The maximum voltage standing wave point on a radiating element
The direction of maximum radiated field strength from the antenna

text: What is the primary function of antenna traps?
choices: To provide balanced feed point impedance

text: Which of the following is used to determine RF exposure from a transmitted signal?
Which of the following is a danger from lead-tin solder?
choices: Lead can contaminate food if hands are not washed carefully after handling the solder
High voltages can cause lead-tin solder to disintegrate suddenly
Tin in the solder can ΓÇ£cold flow,ΓÇ¥ causing shorts in the circuit
RF energy can convert the lead into a poisonous gas
